intro: Phacelia circinata var. acutiloba, commonly known as the sharpleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a sharp, pointed tip, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
